intro: Malvastrum scabrum var. genuinum, commonly known as the rough mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in disturbed areas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like hibiscus and cotton. Its fibrous roots and sprawling growth habit make it a resilient species in arid environments.
